com.vangav.backend.security.cryptography

Class PasswordHashingInl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vangav.backend.security.cryptography.PasswordHashingInl

  • public class PasswordHashingInl
extends java.lang.Object
    PasswordHashingInl: has multiple inline static methods providing multiple options for hashing strings - usually used for one-way encryption to secure things like user passwords Called after passwords since passwords are the most common use for these algorithms but it's not restricted to passwords

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static byte[] fromHex(java.lang.String hex)
      fromHex helper method
      static java.lang.String generatePbkdf2(java.lang.String text)
      generatePbkdf2 generates a secured hashed text using PBKDF1 algorithm PBKDF2 has variable security depending on the value of (iterations) the higher the value of (iterations) the more secure it's but also the slower it's.
      static byte[] getSalt()
      getSalt helper method salt is used to make a hashing more secure
      static java.lang.String getShaNameFromHashedString(java.lang.String hashedText)
      getShaTypeFromHashedString helper method
      static Pair<java.lang.String,byte[]> saltedMd5(java.lang.String text, byte[] salt)
      saltedMd5 similar to simpleMd5 but adds salt to param text before hashing it for added security NOTE: save the returned salt with the hashed text, must use the the exact pair of text and salt to regenerated the same hashed text
      static Pair<java.lang.String,byte[]> sha(java.lang.String shaName, java.lang.String text, byte[] salt)
      sha sha generates more secure hashes than md5 not collision resistant - but collisions are very rare (can be ignored) the higher the number of bits of the sha algorithm, the stronger it is
      static java.lang.String simpleMd5(java.lang.String text)
      simpleMd5 128-bit (16-byte) hash value maximum speed minimum security prone to brute-force and dictionary attacks not collision resistant
      static java.lang.String toHex(byte[] array)
      toHex helper method
      static boolean validatePbkdf2(java.lang.String originalText, java.lang.String hashedText)
      validatePbkdf2 valides that param hashed text is the PBKDF2 hash of param original text

        saltedMd5 similar to simpleMd5 but adds salt to param text before hashing it for added security NOTE: save the returned salt with the hashed text, must use the the exact pair of text and salt to regenerated the same hashed text

        sha sha generates more secure hashes than md5 not collision resistant - but collisions are very rare (can be ignored) the higher the number of bits of the sha algorithm, the stronger it is
        Parameters:

      • generatePbkdf2

        public static java.lang.String generatePbkdf2(java.lang.String text)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        generatePbkdf2 generates a secured hashed text using PBKDF1 algorithm PBKDF2 has variable security depending on the value of (iterations) the higher the value of (iterations) the more secure it's but also the slower it's. it's more secure that SHA but slower basically it's more secure because it's slower (as it slows down brute-force attacks)
        Parameters:
        text - to hash (e.g.: a password)
        Returns:
        hashed text corresponding to param text, embedded in the hash is the number of iterations and the used salt separated by ":" as iterations:salt:hashed_text
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • validatePbkdf2

        public static boolean validatePbkdf2(java.lang.String originalText,
                                     java.lang.String hashedText)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        validatePbkdf2 valides that param hashed text is the PBKDF2 hash of param original text
        Parameters:
        originalText -
        hashedText -
        Returns:
        true for a match and false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
